intro: Sarcanthus yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan sarcanthus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Sarcanthus yunnanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
